sections.headline: 48-Hour As-Builts or It's Free

sections.headline: Why Risk Your Project with Outdated Methods?
bullets: Traditional surveys take 2+ weeks and cost 75% more
Manual measurements are prone to costly errors
Incomplete documentation leads to change orders and delays

sections.headline: Every Day of Delay Costs You Money
sections.content: Construction delays cost an average of $15,000 per day. Inaccurate as-builts cause 30% of all rework, adding weeks to your timeline and destroying your profit margins.

sections.headline: Reality Capture Technology Meets Lightning Speed
Trusted by Industry Leaders
testimonials: The accuracy and speed are unmatched. We saved $50,000 in potential rework on our first project. - John D., Project Manager
Their 48-hour turnaround helped us compress our timeline by 2 weeks. - Sarah M., Construction Director

sections.headline: Complete Reality Capture Package
includes: BIM-ready point cloud and mesh models
2D CAD drawings in your preferred format

sections.headline: Triple Accuracy Guarantee
sections.content: If we miss our 48-hour deadline OR our scans don't meet 0.1mm accuracy, you get a free rescan plus $500 credit. No questions asked.

sections.headline: Limited Time Launch Pricing
sections.content: Lock in $2.00/sqft pricing (43% below market rate) before prices increase next month

linkedin.hook: A $2.1M construction project almost derailed because of a 3-inch measurement error.
linkedin.story:
Our client discovered this error during pre-construction. The existing as-builts were off by just 3 inches - but in construction, precision matters.

They called us at 9am Monday.
linkedin.value: By Wednesday morning, they had new as-builts with 0.1mm accuracy. Project back on track, no delays, no costly rework.
linkedin.cta: When was the last time inaccurate measurements cost you time or money? Share below üëá

thread.hook: üßµ The hidden cost of inaccurate as-builts (and why 48 hours changes everything):
body: 1/ Traditional as-builts take 2+ weeks and are often off by inches. In construction, every inch costs thousands.
2/ Real example: A $2.1M renovation project. Traditional measurements missed 3 inches. Result: $180K in emergency changes.
3/ Our solution: Laser scanning that captures every detail within 0.1mm. Delivered in 48 hours.
4/ Why 48 hours matters: Each day of delay costs ~$10K in labor and equipment standby. Speed = savings.
thread.closer: 5/ Ready to eliminate measurement errors? We guarantee 0.1mm accuracy in 48 hours or it's free. DM for details.

images.prompt: A futuristic cityscape with a laser scanner projecting a digital grid over a skyscraper, symbolizing precision and speed in construction technology.

images.brandElements: Use primary color #3b82f6 for headline text against a background using #0f172a.

images.prompt: A split image showing a traditional construction site on one side and a digital, laser-scanned model on the other, highlighting the contrast in methods.
images.brandElements: Incorporate secondary color #1e40af for the border and accent color #60a5fa for the headline.

images.prompt: A dynamic illustration of a laser scanning device emitting beams that form a highly detailed 3D model of a building.
images.brandElements: Use accent color #60a5fa for the headline text and primary color #3b82f6 for background elements.
